Beetle, Giant Slicer

This creature appears as a giant beetle with a triangular head and two long, razor sharp mandibles. Its body is black in color.



Giant Slicer Beetle

CR 4

XP 1,200
N Large vermin
Init +0; Senses darkvision 60 ft.; Perception +0
DEFENSE
AC 17, touch 9, flat-footed 17 (+8 natural, -1 size)
hp 37 (5d8+15)
Fort +7, Ref +1, Will +1
Immune mind-affecting effects
OFFENSE
Spd 20 ft.
Melee type +8 (2d8+9/19-20)
Space 10 ft.; Reach 5 ft.
Special Attacks vorpal bite
STATISTICS
Str 23, Dex 10, Con 16, Int -, Wis 10, Cha 9
Base Atk +3; CMB +10; CMD 20 (28 vs. trip)
Feats Improved Critical (bite) B
ECOLOGY
Environment temperate forests
Organization solitary or cluster (2-5)
Treasure incidental
SPECIAL ABILITIES
Vorpal Bite (Ex) The mandibles of a slicer beetle are extremely sharp. It gains Improved Critical (bite) as a bonus feat. The mandibles can sever body parts from opponents. If a slicer beetle scores a natural 20 on its attack roll and confirms the critical hit, it severs one of the opponent's extremities (roll 1d6: 1-3 arm, 4-6 leg; 50% chance of either right or left).


The slicer beetle closely resembles a large stag beetle and is often mistaken for such. However, the slicer beetle is more aggressive than the stag beetle. The creature dines on carrion, fresh meat, and leaves.

Stag beetles are about 10 feet long, but can grow to lengths of 20 feet or more.

The slicer beetle attacks by biting with its mandibles. A critical hit by the slicer beetle has a chance of severing a foe's arm or leg.
